intro: Nemexia, commonly known as the "buttercup grass," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa, particularly in regions with arid or semi-arid climates. Nemexia species are typically low-growing, herbaceous plants with small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. They have fibrous roots and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their delicate appearance.
